TITLE: Reno Is Booming. Some Workers Feel Left Behind.
SUMMARY: Companies are flocking to the Nevada city, but the rising cost of housing, gas and groceries is making daily life a struggle for many who work there.

TITLE: Kroger and Albertsons Announce Plan to Merge in $25 Billion Deal
SUMMARY: The deal, an effort to bulk up against deep-pocketed rivals Walmart and Amazon, is likely to invite antitrust scrutiny from regulators.

TITLE: Why Social Security’s Inflation Protection Is Priceless
SUMMARY: Automatically adjusted lifetime income is rare and worth protecting, our columnist says.

TITLE: I’m Young. Should I Care About Social Security?
SUMMARY: One reason: You pay for it. And, despite what many Americans believe, it’s “definitely a misconception” that it will run out before you retire, experts say.

TITLE: Inflation Was Much Hotter Than Expected, Bad News For the Fed
SUMMARY: Inflation rose quickly in September and a key measure accelerated to the fastest pace since 1982, underlining the persistence of price increases.

TITLE: The Social Security COLA Increase Will Ease the Sting of Inflation
SUMMARY: The cost-of-living adjustment will be 8.7 percent next year, bringing relief to retirees and others who rely largely on the payments.

TITLE: Markets Plunge After High CPI Inflation Reading
SUMMARY: Stocks initially tumbled, then rebounded sharply after a report that signaled the Fed would continue raising interest rates aggressively.

TITLE: Netflix to Offer Cheaper Ad Option Beginning Nov. 3
SUMMARY: Viewers who choose the $6.99 subscription will be shown four to five minutes of ads for every hour of content they watch.

TITLE: Wells Fargo’s Scandals Drag on Profit as It Braces for a ‘Slowing Economy’
A “Roller Coaster” Day Whipsaws Markets
SUMMARY: Not even a worse-than-expected inflation report could sap investor enthusiasm. But analysts and traders worry that unpredictable market moves will continue.

TITLE: JPMorgan’s Profit Shrinks, but Chief Says U.S. Customers Are ‘Healthy’
SUMMARY: The bank earned $9.7 billion in the third quarter, down from last year. It also added to reserves against loan losses and took a hit on some investments.

TITLE: War Colliding With Recession Risks Leave Energy Markets on Uncertain Path
SUMMARY: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, along with governments’ reactions to that, might mean that prices rise. Or they could fall on fears of a global economic slowdown.

TITLE: Investing for Your Values, but Betting on Growth
SUMMARY: Socially conscious funds often hold lots of growth stocks, especially tech shares. That’s been painful this year, as the stock market has favored value stocks like energy and industrial companies.

TITLE: Twitter and TikTok Lead in Amplifying Misinformation, Report Finds
SUMMARY: A new analysis found that algorithms and some features of social media sites help false posts go viral.

TITLE: Google’s Move to Include Truth Social in App Store Buoys Investor Confidence
SUMMARY: Shares of the SPAC trying to merge with Donald Trump’s social media company rose on Thursday after the decision.

TITLE: Andrew Bailey Battles Inflation Amid Britain’s Financial Storm
SUMMARY: Andrew Bailey, the Bank of England chief, is trying to calm markets, wrestle inflation and maintain the bank’s credibility amid Britain’s financial storm.

TITLE: Robert Toll, Who Mass-Produced ‘McMansions,’ Is Dead at 81
SUMMARY: He and his brother, Bruce, founded a home-building company that found suburbia fertile ground to make hundreds of millions of dollars with roomy dwellings.

TITLE: F.D.A. Confirms Widespread Shortages of Adderall
SUMMARY: The agency cited Teva’s continuing supply problems as well as those of other drug makers struggling to fill the gap.

TITLE: Kroger and Albertsons, Grocery Giants, Are Said to Be in Talks to Merge
SUMMARY: A deal could be the industry’s largest in years and would almost certainly invite antitrust scrutiny from regulators.

TITLE: 2023 COLA Could Strain Social Security Program’s Solvency
SUMMARY: The Social Security Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund could be depleted a year or two earlier than expected as a result of larger payouts.

TITLE: Elizabeth Warren Singles Out Wells Fargo for ‘Alarming Pattern’ of Zelle Fraud
SUMMARY: Customers’ claims have risen sharply in recent years and exceed the rate reported by other large banks, the senator said in a letter to the bank’s leader.

TITLE: With New Crackdown, Biden Wages Global Campaign on Chinese Technology
SUMMARY: U.S. officials pushed to choke off China’s access to critical semiconductor technology after internal debates and tough negotiations with allies.

TITLE: Takeaways From Another Painful CPI Inflation Report
SUMMARY: Here’s what to know from the Consumer Price Index report for September.

TITLE: France Sends Gas to Germany to Offset Russia Supply Cuts
SUMMARY: The shipment of natural gas, through a reopened pipeline connection, is part of a deal that calls for Germany to supply electricity to France.

TITLE: Gas Prices Fall Slightly, but Overall Energy Costs Are Expected to Rise.
SUMMARY: An increase in energy prices could complicate the Federal Reserve’s campaign to tame inflation.

TITLE: Last Inflation Report Before Midterms Tests Stock Market
SUMMARY: Higher-than-expected inflation data gave cold comfort to policymakers and investors alike.

TITLE: Battle Over Wage Rules for Tipped Workers Is Heating Up
SUMMARY: A system counting tips toward the minimum wage is being fought in many places. Critics say it’s often abused. Defenders say workers benefit overall.

TITLE: Delta Earnings Are Solid as Airline Signals Optimism on Travel Demand
SUMMARY: The carrier reported a healthy profit for the third quarter after a busy summer. Competitors also seem confident despite economic turbulence.

TITLE: Treasury Scrutinizes Florida’s Use of Relief Funds in Sending Away Migrants
SUMMARY: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida used interest that the state had accrued from stimulus money to send Venezuelan migrants by plane to Martha’s Vineyard.

TITLE: Art Laboe, D.J. Who Popularized ‘Oldies but Goodies,’ Dies at 97
SUMMARY: A familiar voice on the California airwaves for almost 80 years, he saw the appeal of old rock ’n’ roll records practically before they were old.

TITLE: Gannett Announces Widespread Cost-Cutting
SUMMARY: The moves at the nation’s largest newspaper publisher include a week of mandatory unpaid leave and voluntary buyouts.

TITLE: Have You Been Shortchanged on Tipped Wages? We Want to Hear From You.
SUMMARY: Most states allow workers to be paid less than the usual minimum wage if they get tips. Experts say the system is often abused at employees’ expense.

TITLE: Liz Truss Stirs Uncertainty Over the U.K.’s Economic Plans
SUMMARY: Prime Minister Liz Truss appeared to rule out cuts in public spending, as doubts about the fiscal soundness of the government’s program continued to roil the markets.

TITLE: Lucid Increases Electric Vehicle Production but Still Faces Challenges
SUMMARY: The maker of electric sedans said it would hit its scaled-back production targets for 2022 after facing supply hurdles.

TITLE: Federal Reserve Worry About Faster Inflation at Last Meeting
SUMMARY: Minutes from the Fed’s September meeting showed many were more worried about doing too little to control inflation than too much.

TITLE: Turmoil Returns to the U.K. Bond Market
SUMMARY: The Bank of England started a bond-buying program last month to stabilize financial markets. But its plan to end the program this Friday is only making investors more nervous.

TITLE: Pepsi Defies Fears of Slowdown with Strong Earnings and Forecast
SUMMARY: Quarterly results provided a sign that shoppers continued to spend despite high inflation squeezing their wallets.

TITLE: Netflix Nears Deal to Build Huge Production Complex on Jersey Shore
SUMMARY: The company was the top bidder for land occupied by a former Army base.

TITLE: UK Markets Thrown Into Turmoil Once Again
SUMMARY: The central bank confirmed it will let a debt-buying program expire, worrying investors about the stability of the market for government bonds.

TITLE: Misinformation Swirls in Non-English Languages Ahead of Midterms
SUMMARY: More multilingual fact-checking groups are pushing back against misleading translations, manipulated images and outright lies that jump platforms and cross borders.

TITLE: China’s Covid-Testing Strategy Comes Under Strain
SUMMARY: Bills are piling up and infections are spreading, yet there are no signs that Beijing plans to rethink a cornerstone of its pandemic policy.

TITLE: Can Start-Ups Significantly Lower the Cost of Gene Sequencing?
SUMMARY: Companies like Ultima Genomics say they have the technology, which could lead to medical breakthroughs. But similar promises in the past have fizzled and barriers remain.

TITLE: Labor Hoarding Could be Good News for the Economy
SUMMARY: Employers have been burned by a labor shortage. Will that make them act differently if the economy slows down?

TITLE: The E-Bike: The New Car Alternative
SUMMARY: VanMoof, the Dutch e-bike company taking inspiration from Apple and Tesla, is one of the world’s hottest brands in a bike market remade by the pandemic. Will it help reshape urban transportation?

TITLE: Quarterly Earnings Likely to Give Mixed Signals to Investors
SUMMARY: Investors, weary of guessing where the Fed’s battle on inflation will take the economy, hope that third-quarter company earnings will bring clarity.

TITLE: Lufthansa Says Passengers Can’t Use Apple AirTags to Track Checked Bags
SUMMARY: It appears to be the sole airline saying that international standards don’t allow passengers to use the Bluetooth devices in the cargo hold. Apple said that regulators allow their use for all baggage.

TITLE: France Tries to Contain Strikes That Have Left Gas Pumps Empty
SUMMARY: Unions have blockaded French oil refineries to demand a 10 percent wage increase as a cost-of-living crisis spirals higher.

TITLE: First Satellite Launch Approaches for Britain
SUMMARY: A Virgin Orbit plane designed to put satellites into orbit is expected to arrive at a new Cornwall spaceport.

TITLE: Amazon Labor Union, With Renewed Momentum, Faces Next Test
SUMMARY: A vote this week at a warehouse near Albany, N.Y., will help show whether the upstart union can win outside its home base on Staten Island.

TITLE: Bittrex Fined $24 Million for Breaking U.S. Sanctions
SUMMARY: Bittrex allowed customers in Cuba, Iran, Sudan, Syria and the Crimea region of Ukraine to trade virtual currencies, according to the Treasury Department.

TITLE: Biden Vows ‘Consequences’ for Saudi Arabia After Oil Production Cut
SUMMARY: Angered by the kingdom’s decision to team up with Russia, President Biden signaled openness to retaliatory measures, including a halt to arms sales and allowing price-fixing lawsuits.

TITLE: Bank of England Expands Market Intervention to Avoid a ‘Fire Sale’
SUMMARY: In the final week of its emergency bond-buying program, the central bank is expanding its efforts to restore bond market function.

TITLE: IMF Warns Rate Increases Could Spur A Global Recession
SUMMARY: The International Monetary Fund lowered its growth outlook for 2023 and suggested that interest rate increases could spur a harsh global recession.

TITLE: Biden Proposal Could Lead to Employee Status for Gig Workers
SUMMARY: A proposed rule, long awaited by labor activists, would make it harder for companies to classify workers as independent contractors.

TITLE: Reassessing Ben Bernanke’s Record
SUMMARY: After winning the Nobel prize for economics, the former Federal Reserve chairman’s record on the economy is getting further scrutiny.

TITLE: As Hospitals Close Children’s Units, Where Does That Leave Lachlan?
SUMMARY: Adult beds are more lucrative than children’s beds. So as institutions look to boost profit margins, pediatrics is often among the first services to be cut.

TITLE: Gig Workers Are Learning Their Worth With the Para App
SUMMARY: A former Uber employee created an app to help drivers. The platforms that hire them are fighting back.

TITLE: Can This Man Solve Europe’s Energy Conundrum?
SUMMARY: Marco Alverà has big plans to produce a “green gas” from hydrogen that uses existing infrastructure.

TITLE: Nikki Finke, Caustic Hollywood Chronicler, Is Dead at 68
SUMMARY: At newspapers and then at Deadline, the website she founded, she served up the opposite of fluff entertainment journalism.
